document.docAuthor: Nurinsiyah, Ayu Savitri, Neiber, Marco T. & Hausdorf, Bernhard
document.docTitle: Landouria parahyangensis Nurinsiyah & Neiber & Hausdorf 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the land snail genus Landouria Godwin-Austen, 1918 (Gastropoda, Camaenidae) from Java

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the land snail genus Landouria Godwin-Austen, 1918 (Gastropoda, Camaenidae) from Java

subSubSection.paragraph:
Landouria parahyangensis
sp. nov. is characterized by a sharply keeled, tightly coiled conical shell with a very wide umbilicus.

Landouria parahyangensis
sp. nov. is named after its occurrence in the mountainous region Parahyangan. In the Sundanese language, the name ʻParahyanganʼ means ʻthe abode of hyangs (gods)ʼ, which were supposed to reside in the mountain tops.

INDONESIA –
West Java

Landouria parahyangensis
sp. nov. resembles
L. epiplatia
(Figs 26–28) with regard to the wide umbilicus. It differs from
L. epiplatia
in the less sharply keeled, higher, conical shell (H 8.4–9.3 mm vs 5.7–6.9 mm in
L. epiplatia
; D/H 1.69–1.94 vs 2.03–2.94 in
L. epiplatia
) with more whorls (6.5–7

Landouria parahyangensis
sp. nov. also resembles
L. naggsi
sp. nov. (Fig. 25). For differences, see remarks under that species.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Landouria parahyangensis
sp. nov. is endemic to the Karangnunggal karst area in West Java (Fig. 54).
